setup.title: Anemone Initial Setup

setup.info: This setup will only be performed once. Make sure to save your information carefully.

peers.password.label: üîê Synchronization Password

peers.sync_config.enable_help: Automatically synchronize shares to this peer
peers.sync_config.day_of_week_help: Day of the week for weekly synchronization
peers.sync_config.day_of_month_help: Day of the month for monthly synchronization (1-31)

shares.name.help: A unique name for this share (e.g., documents, photos)
shares.delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this share?
shares.empty.help: Create a share to start storing your files
shares.info: Shares allow you to access your files via SMB/CIFS from your local network.
shares.access_info: Use this path to connect from Windows, macOS or Linux
trash.title: Trash
trash.card_description_retention: Recover your deleted files (30 days retention)
trash.confirm_delete:
‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Permanently delete this file?

This action is irreversible.
trash.confirm_delete_bulk:
‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Permanently delete {count} file(s)?

This action is irreversible.
trash.settings.title: Trash Settings
trash.settings.description: Configure file retention duration in the trash
trash.settings.auto_delete_info: Deleted files are automatically permanently deleted after {{days}} days in the trash.
trash.settings.retention_days_help: Number of days before automatic deletion of files in the trash. 0 = disabled (infinite retention).
trash.settings.info_1: Files deleted by users are placed in the trash (.trash folder)
trash.settings.info_2: After the configured retention period, files are automatically permanently deleted
trash.settings.info_3: Automatic cleanup runs at each server restart and periodically
trash.settings.info_4: Users can always empty their trash manually at any time

backup.export.title: Server Backup Export
backup.export.users_keys: All user accounts and their encrypted keys
backup.export.encrypted: The backup will be encrypted with your passphrase
backup.export.keep_safe: Keep the passphrase safe - you'll need it to restore
backup.export.no_files: The backup does NOT include user files, only configuration
backup.export.store_secure: Store the backup file in a secure location
backup.export.server_name_help: A descriptive name to identify this backup
backup.export.passphrase_help: This passphrase will encrypt the backup. Keep it safe!
backup.export.confirm_checkbox: I understand that I need this passphrase to restore the server
backup.export.restore_text: To restore this backup on a fresh Anemone installation:
backup.export.restore_script_note: The restore script is included in the Anemone repository
backup.export.alert_too_short: Passphrase must be at least 12 characters long
backup.export.alert_confirm: Please confirm that you understand the backup process
backup.export.alert_ready: Are you ready to export the server configuration? Make sure to save the passphrase in a safe place.
users.page.description: Manage user accounts and create new accounts
users.empty.title: No users
users.empty.message: Start by creating a new user.
users.delete.warning_message:
This action will PERMANENTLY delete:
‚Ä¢ The user from the database
‚Ä¢ ALL SMB shares of this user
‚Ä¢ ALL FILES on disk (backup + data)
‚Ä¢ The Linux system user
‚Ä¢ The Samba user

This action is IRREVERSIBLE!
All user files will be lost.

Type the username to confirm:
users.delete.final_confirm: Final confirmation: Are you absolutely sure you want to delete this user and ALL their data?
users.delete.success: ‚úÖ User and all data successfully deleted
users.delete.cancelled: ‚ùå Username does not match. Deletion cancelled.

backup.info.encrypted: Backups are encrypted and stored on the server
backup.info.password_required: When downloading, you will need to choose a password to secure the file
backup.info.keep_password: Keep this password safe, you will need it for restoration
backup.info.includes: Backups include: users, shares, peers, system configuration
backup.info.no_files: User files are NOT included in server backups

admin.settings.title: Security Settings
admin.settings.sync_description: Protect your server against unauthorized connections
admin.settings.password_configured_help: Synchronization endpoints are protected. Peers must provide the correct password to send backups to this server.
admin.settings.no_password_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Any server can store backups on this server without authentication. Configure a password to secure access.
admin.settings.password_help: This password must be configured on peers that want to send backups to this server.
admin.settings.info_1: The password configured here protects the /api/sync/* endpoints of this server
admin.settings.info_2: When a peer wants to send backups to this server, it must provide this password
admin.settings.info_3: The password is sent in the HTTP header X-Sync-Password
admin.settings.info_4: If the password is incorrect or missing, synchronization is rejected (401/403)
admin.sync.title: Automatic Synchronization
admin.sync.description: Configure automatic synchronization of all shares to peers.
admin.sync.config.title: Configuration
admin.sync.config.fixed_hour_help: E.g., 23 to synchronize at 11pm every night
admin.sync.manual.title: Manual Synchronization
admin.sync.manual.description: Force immediate synchronization of all shares with sync enabled to all peers.
admin.sync.manual.confirm: Start synchronization of all users now?
admin.sync.report.title: Recent Synchronizations
admin.incoming.title: Peers connected to me
admin.incoming.description: Remote servers storing backups on this server

restore.warning.title: Server Restored
restore.warning.header: This server was restored from a backup
restore.warning.info_1: Your user configuration has been restored (account, passwords, quotas)
restore.warning.info_2: Your SMB shares are configured again
restore.warning.info_3: Your files are not yet on this server
restore.warning.info_4: Your files still exist encrypted on remote peer servers
restore.warning.backups.title: Available backups
restore.warning.backups.admin_info: As an administrator, you can restore user files from the admin interface
restore.warning.option1.title: Option 1: Manual restore
restore.warning.option1.description: I will transfer my files from my PC via SMB.
restore.warning.option1.note: (Recommended if you have a local copy of your files)
restore.warning.option2.title: Option 2: Restore user files (Admin)
restore.warning.option2.description: Access admin interface to automatically restore all users' files from peer servers.
restore.warning.help.title: Need help?
restore.warning.help.message: Contact your administrator for more information about server restoration.

restore.empty.title: No backups available
restore.empty.message: No backups have been created yet.
restore.error.selection: Please select at least one item

admin.restore_users.backups.info: Click "Restore" to recover a user's files
admin.restore_users.empty: No backups available. Make sure peer servers are online and users have saved files.

admin.restore_users.success_all: All restorations have been started successfully!
dashboard.user.restore.title: Restore Files
dashboard.user.restore.description: Restore your files from encrypted backups.
users.quota.compression_note_text: Quotas are applied to the actual disk space used. Thanks to Btrfs compression, users can store more data than the quota limit (typically 20-50% more depending on file types).
admin.restore_users.info: Click "Restore" to recover a user's files
admin.restore_users.empty.message: No backups available. Make sure peer servers are online and users have backed up files.
update.page.title: System Updates
update.status.title: Version Status
update.info.auto_check: Anemone automatically checks for updates once per day. You can force a manual check with the button above.
update.install.confirm_message: Are you sure you want to update Anemone?

update.install.success: Update launched successfully. The server will restart in a few seconds...
update.install.restarting: Server is restarting. You will be redirected to the login page...
storage.title: Storage Management
storage.info: Monitor the health of your disks and storage pools
storage.no_pools_info: Create a ZFS pool for data protection
storage.zfs_install_info: Install ZFS to manage your storage pools
storage.confirm_scrub: Do you want to start a scrub on this pool? This operation verifies data integrity.
storage.smart_not_available: SMART data is not available for this disk
dashboard.storage_mgmt.title: Storage Management
dashboard.storage_mgmt.description: Monitor the health of your disks and ZFS pools
storage.mountpoint_help: Path where the pool will be mounted (e.g., /mnt/data). Empty = /<pool_name>
storage.create_pool_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è This operation will create a new ZFS pool with the selected disks. Existing data on these disks will be lost.
storage.destroy_pool_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This operation will DESTROY the pool and ALL its data. This action is IRREVERSIBLE!
storage.export_pool_warning: The pool will be exported and will no longer be accessible until reimported.
storage.import_pool_warning: The pool will be imported and made accessible on this system.
storage.create_dataset_warning: A new dataset will be created with the specified settings.
storage.delete_dataset_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: All data in this dataset will be DELETED. This action is IRREVERSIBLE!
storage.snapshot_name_help: Letters, numbers, dashes and dots only
storage.delete_snapshot_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è This snapshot will be permanently deleted.
storage.rollback_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: The dataset will be restored to this snapshot state. All more recent snapshots will be DELETED!
storage.format_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Formatting will DESTROY all data on this disk!
storage.label: Label
storage.format_disk_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: All data on this disk will be LOST. This action is IRREVERSIBLE!
setup_wizard.title: Anemone Setup
setup_wizard.mode.title: Welcome to Anemone
setup_wizard.mode.description: Choose how you want to configure your NAS server.

setup_wizard.mode.new.description: Configure a new Anemone server from scratch.
setup_wizard.mode.restore.title: Restore from Backup
setup_wizard.mode.restore.description: Restore a previously backed up server.
setup_wizard.mode.import.title: Import Existing ZFS Pool
setup_wizard.mode.import.description: Recover data from an existing ZFS pool (e.g., after reinstallation).
setup_wizard.storage.title: Storage Configuration
setup_wizard.storage.description: Choose where Anemone data will be stored.
setup_wizard.storage.data_dir_help: Path where all data will be stored (DB, shares, etc.)
setup_wizard.storage.disk_in_use: This disk is already in use
setup_wizard.incoming.title: Incoming Backup Storage
setup_wizard.incoming.description: Remote peers can backup their data to this server. Where do you want to store these backups?
setup_wizard.incoming.same.title: Same Location
setup_wizard.incoming.same.description: Store incoming backups in the same location as main data.
setup_wizard.incoming.separate.title: Separate Location
setup_wizard.incoming.separate.descripti: Store incoming backups on a different disk or directory.
setup_wizard.incoming.path_help: Path where backups from remote peers will be stored
setup_wizard.admin.title: Create Administrator Account
setup_wizard.admin.description: This account will have full access to Anemone administration.
setup_wizard.admin.username_help: Lowercase letters, numbers, dashes and underscores only
setup_wizard.summary.title: Configuration Summary
setup_wizard.summary.description: Review settings before finalizing the installation.
setup_wizard.summary.warning_message: The installation will create the database and configure storage. This operation may take a few minutes.
setup_wizard.success.title: Setup Complete!
setup_wizard.success.description: Anemone is now configured and ready to use.
setup_wizard.complete.title: Setup Complete
setup_wizard.complete.description: Anemone setup is complete. Restart the service to apply the configuration.
setup_wizard.complete.restart_hint: Run this command to restart the service:
setup_wizard.complete.after_restart: After the service restarts, click the button below to access the interface.
setup_wizard.restore.upload.title: Upload Backup
setup_wizard.restore.upload.description: Select the server backup file and enter the passphrase used during export.
setup_wizard.restore.upload.drop_file: Drag and drop your file here or
setup_wizard.restore.upload.passphrase_h: The passphrase used when exporting the backup (or the master key for automatic backups).
setup_wizard.restore.confirm.title: Confirm Restoration
setup_wizard.restore.confirm.description: Review the backup contents before proceeding with the restore.
setup_wizard.restore.confirm.warning: This operation will create a new database with the backup data. User passwords will be preserved.
setup_wizard.restore.success.title: Restoration Complete!
setup_wizard.restore.success.description: Your server has been successfully restored from the backup.
